issue.title: Support WMS DescribeLayer Request
issue.body:
**Original author :** Portier Thomas

The DescribeLayer request is not yet supported by the PROXY. 
It must be possible to assign to the wms a new wfs adress.

comments.body:
**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

Hello Thomas,

I am not sur to get the whole picture of this issue... it seems there are two differents issues :

1. When you say "The DescribeLayer request is not yet supported by the PROXY", it means that a remote server supporting DescribeLayer request cannot be properly relayed by the PROXY, that's right ?


2. When you say "It must be possible to assign to the wms a new wfs adress", you mean the PROXY should be able to rewrite the XML response by adding/changing the WFS (or WCS) corresponding to the WMY layer. It it so ?

Thanks for your answer ;-)

**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

Thomas, since we are soon putting new contributions into the PROXY, I would like to have your comment on this issue... can you answers my previous questions ? ;-)

**Original author :** Portier Thomas

1. Yes that's right. The DescribeLayer checkbox in the policy admin panel is 
always disabled. That's logical, indeed the describeLayer request gives the 
coresponding wfs for a wms (in geoserver when you had a new layer, it creates a 
wms and a wfs with the same data).
2. Yes. We can also imagine to add a login/password to access to this service.
